### equalsInt() {#a9e4ce57aa4a42de3b4eeea3877d14b90}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::equalsInt (uint64&#95;t V) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
A helper method that can be used to determine if the constant contained within is equal to a constant.

This only works for very small values, because this is all that can be represented with all types. Determine if this constant&#39;s value is same as an unsigned char.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00163">163</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getAlignValue() {#af5c879521832541d02584c533df0a6ce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="Align llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getAlignValue () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the constant as an <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">llvm::Align</a>, interpreting <code>0</code> as <code>Align(1)</code>.

Note that this method can assert if the value does not fit in 64 bits or is not a power of two.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00155">155</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.

### getIntegerType() {#a8926bd3f2d482439d11aaecd3eda70a3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>IntegerType &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getIntegerType () const</>}>
Variant of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/value/#a5f93ad2195368bba2202c3cc75e7cc1d">getType()</a> method to always return an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/integertype">IntegerType</a>, which reduces the amount of casting needed in parts of the compiler.

### getLimitedValue() {#ad17d5b90a3ee8f5097a8beaa9eeb74c5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getLimitedValue (uint64&#95;t Limit=~0ULL) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
getLimitedValue - If the value is smaller than the specified limit, return it, otherwise return the limit value.

This causes the value to saturate to the limit. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
the min of the value of the constant and the specified value Get the constant&#39;s value with a saturation limit
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00234">234</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.

  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the constant as an <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/maybealign">llvm::MaybeAlign</a>.

Note that this method can assert if the value does not fit in 64 bits or is not a power of two.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>int64&#95;t llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getSExtValue () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the constant as a 64-bit integer value after it has been sign extended as appropriate for the type of this constant.

Note that this method can assert if the value does not fit in 64 bits. Return the sign extended value.

  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getZExtValue () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return the constant as a 64-bit unsigned integer value after it has been zero extended as appropriate for the type of this constant.

Note that this method can assert if the value does not fit in 64 bits. Return the zero extended value.

\\Returns the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/use">Use</a> for the <code>OpIdx&#39;th</code> operand.

This is virtual to allow instructions to deviate from the LLVM IR operands, which is a requirement for sandboxir Instructions that consist of more than one LLVM <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/instruction">Instruction</a>.

### get() {#afea8011a4f0a7b3c537b7221a6516a43}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantInt &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::get (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/integertype">IntegerType</a> &#42; Ty, uint64&#95;t V, bool IsSigned=false)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantint">ConstantInt</a> with the specified integer value for the specified type.

If the type is wider than 64 bits, the value will be zero-extended to fit the type, unless IsSigned is true, in which case the value will be interpreted as a 64-bit signed integer and sign-extended to fit the type. Get a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantint">ConstantInt</a> for a specific value.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00096">96</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00053">53</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.

### getSigned() {#ac1a389bdaa3ebce098a56a1f6b8f972b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ConstantInt &#42; llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::getSigned (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/integertype">IntegerType</a> &#42; Ty, int64&#95;t V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantint">ConstantInt</a> with the specified value for the specified type.

The value V will be canonicalized to a an unsigned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a>. Accessing it with either <a href="#a71943e74a4433d0f7b517a3f3bdd25fd">getSExtValue()</a> or <a href="#ae8e37e9cbc36a46d0059d114a0c24ece">getZExtValue()</a> will yield a correctly sized and signed value for the type Ty. Get a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantint">ConstantInt</a> for a specific signed value.

### isValueValidForType() {#adc066174be9b1f45b7c87cd63e7262d5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sandboxir::ConstantInt::isValueValidForType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, uint64&#95;t V)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This static method returns true if the type Ty is big enough to represent the value V.

This can be used to avoid having the get method assert when V is larger than Ty can represent. Note that there are two versions of this method, one for unsigned and one for signed integers. Although <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/constantint">ConstantInt</a> canonicalizes everything to an unsigned integer, the signed version avoids callers having to convert a signed quantity to the appropriate unsigned type before calling the method. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if V is a valid value for type Ty Determine if the value is in range for the given type.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00180">180</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00084">84</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00181">181</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00087">87</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.
